original_title: Flexure PCB Actuators Made Before Your Very Eyes
original_content:
When we see something from [Carl Bugeja], we expect to see flexible PCBs and magnets being pushed to do unexpected things. His latest video in which he designs a set of PCB actuators using flexure joints certainly doesnt fail to please.
His intent is to create a simple actuator in which a magnet is placed over a coil, and moves upward within the confines of he flexure which surrounds it. And rather than try individual designs one after the other hes created a huge all-in-one test array of different flexure actuators, each having a slightly different design and construction to whichever one is next to it. There are plenty of magnet flips as he tests them, and using this approach hes quickly able to eliminate the designs which work less well.
To give an idea how these actuators might be best used, he tried them in a few applications. Their lifting force is relatively tiny, but he found them possibly suitable for a haptic feedback device. Of particular interest is that as the structure is a PCB its relatively straightforward to run a line to the magnet and turn it into a touch sensor. The idea of an all in one sensor and haptic feedback component is rather appealing, we think.
If youve not seen Carls work before, weve encountered him many times over the years.
title: "柔軟なPCBとマグネットを使用したアクチュエータのデザイン方法"
body: 柔軟なPCBと磁石から予想通りの驚きのものを作るCarl Bugeja氏。彼がフレクスチャージョイントを使用してPCBアクチュエータのセットを設計する最新のビデオは、期待に応えます。これらのアクチュエータは、マグネットをコイルの上に置き、周囲にセットされたフレクスチャー内で上方向に移動するシンプルな構造です。彼は異なるデザインと構造を持つ複数のフレクスチャーアクチュエータをテスト用の配列にしました。彼はそれらをテストする中でデザインの選別を行いました。これらのアクチュエータは、触覚フィードバックデバイスに可能性があると試してみました。特に興味深いのは、PCB構造に線を引いて磁石をタッチセンサーに変えることが比較的簡単にできることです。オールインワンのセンサーと触覚フィードバックコンポーネントのアイデアは魅力的です。
